results.firPara: We asked supporters for their hopes for the season, but confidence is in short supply. Our Leicester City fan would take 17th – and lets not even start on Hull

results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Mesut Özil out, Robert Lewandowski in at Arsenal?

results.firPara: Walter Mazzarri has said he still hopes to strengthen the spine of his Watford team with two or three new players, as the countdown to the Premier League kick off continues.
results.secPara: The 54-year-old Italian has become the Hornets seventh coach in five seasons since taking over from the popular Quique Sánchez Flores. Watford have been largely quiet in the transfer window this summer, with striker Isaac Success and defender Christian Kabasele being their sole big-money signings. But Mazzarri hopes to change that.
results.webTitle: Watford manager Walter Mazzarri says he needs ‘two or three new players’

results.firPara: • Liverpool to play second-round match at Burton Albion
results.secPara: Aston Villas manager Roberto Di Matteo has called for his side to go back to basics after crashing out of the EFL Cup with a 3-1 defeat to League Two Luton Town.
results.webTitle: EFL Cup roundup and draw: Aston Villa knocked out by League Two Luton

results.firPara: Jack Wilshere has been here before. If anybody knows how long and treacherous the road back to form and acceptance can be, it is he. But as he considers the new season with Arsenal, and his latest quest for a sustained run without injuries, he can feel another echo from the recent past. It is one that will haunt him and, he fears, track him at away grounds across the country.
results.secPara: It will be the same for his England team-mates – every one of them involved in the Euro 2016 defeat against Iceland, when the 2-1 elimination in the last 16 was, arguably, the worst result of the nations footballing history.
results.webTitle: Jack Wilshere braced for jeers to soundtrack the season after Euro failure

results.firPara: Riyad Mahrez has accepted he will not be allowed to leave Leicester this month after talks between his representatives and the Premier League champions director of football on Wednesday.
results.secPara: Last seasons PFA Player of the Year expressed his desire to move last month after turning down a new contract worth around £80,000 a week. Yet Leicesters owners, having sold NGolo Kanté to Chelsea and persuaded Jamie Vardy to reject a transfer to Arsenal, were adamant Mahrez would not be allowed to depart despite interest from several clubs in the Premier League and overseas.
results.webTitle: Riyad Mahrez agrees not to leave Leicester in current transfer window

results.firPara: • 31-year-old central defender signs three-year contract at Goodison Park
results.secPara: Everton have signed the Swansea City and Wales captain Ashley Williams for an undisclosed fee, believed to be £11m, on a three-year contract with the defender saying he has joined a great club with an unbelievable manager – a world legend in football.
results.webTitle: Everton sign Wales captain Ashley Williams from Swansea City

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Arsenal, Jazz hands, and a welcome injection of celebrity

results.webTitle: The Fiver | Limp, entirely predictable failure

results.firPara: Hull City could soon be under Chinese ownership after it emerged the owners, the Allam family, are in advanced talks to sell the Premier League club.
results.secPara: Ehab Allam, Hulls vice-chairman, is discussing a sale with Dai Yongge and his sister Hawken Xiu Li who are leading a consortium of investors from mainland China and Hong Kong.
results.webTitle: Hull City owners in advanced talks to sell club to Chinese investors
